page.title: 07Modern Farming in Marton.
page.content: We visited a local farm of about 250 acres to discover how the farmer of 1985 manages his land.The farm was highly mechanised with machinery available for sowing,harvesting,drying and transport.All the machinery was expensive and we realised how much time and money is spent keeping it in good working order. There was a combine harvester which cuts the harvest,separates the grain from the straw and collects the crop.The straw is later baled. The baler is drawn by one of the tractors.The farmer no longer relies on the sun to dry his hay.It is baled and brought into a special shed where it is blown dry. This makes a better quality of hay.The cattle are milked by machinery and their yield is carefully measured. During milking each cow is given a carefully calculated amount of cake.
